author: carl_thee_cow
title: Awesome
review: I got this set on my birthday in 2002 and it was awesome! Since Lego didn't make any big airplane capable of carrying many passagers this was the one to get. It comes with the orange engines and sliver proplers. It is really easy to put togther and can carry many passngers. I would give it a five.

author: modena
title: Where's the engines?
review:
I loved this set, and even without the engines I still admire this plane.

Pros:

  • Lots of space for cargo!
  • Lots of rudders!
  • Nice engines!

Cons:

  • I lost the engines.
  • Easy to build.
  • "Childish" minifigures.

Overall:

This was a very nice set, the only problem was that I lost the engines for some strange reason, when I was little. Overall, those engines look beautiful! The only problem is how it gets boring when you grow older. The minifigures, the big bricks, and so on.

Overall, a nice set for a little boy that likes building with Lego.

author: Rudolfo
title: What is this?
review:
My wife bought this on ebay. I could have sworn it was a (convincingly branded) fake until I found it on here.

Big by normal Lego plane standards. The kids (8 & 10) like it. The engines, big single plate wings and printed body sections don't feel very Lego-ish to me.

I guess the 2000s fell between my KFOL and AFOL days.
